name: Genome-Peptide-Structure
tagline: A workshop to discuss interconnection of PDB, Kaviar, PeptideAtlas, and TPP
body:
A two-day workshop at the [Institute for Systems Biology](systemsbiology.org) in Seattle, Washington, for collaborators and other researchers working toward the interconnection of genomic, proteomic, and protein structure data. Our ultimate goal is to tie together four established resources:
* the RCSB [Protein Data Bank](rcsb.org)
* the [Kaviar](db.systemsbiology.org/kaviar) database of human genomic variation
* the [PeptideAtlas](www.peptideatlas.org) proteomics data compendium
* the [Trans-Proteomic Pipeline](http://tools.proteomecenter.org/wiki/index.php?title=Software:TPP) software

This workshop is funded by a [Big Data Spoke Planning Grant](tfarrah.github.io/Genome-Peptide-Structure/bdspokes-proposal.pdf).

The workshop will take place sometime during the first two weeks of January, 2017.

Contact Eric Deutsch, edeutsch@systemsbiology.org, if you are interested in being invited.
